docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate Democrats have offered an amendment designed to move the ball forward on Iraq and clarify their position on this contentious issue. Hillary Clinton is an original co-sponsor of the legislation, and according to Congressional sources familiar with the process, she played an active behind-the-scenes role in crafting it.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton has been falsely accused of many things, but David Brooks's statement that ''nobody, not even among her friends, is totally sure she actually believes in anything, or whether she just coldly calculates political advantage'' upsets me the most because he casually dismisses what has driven Senator Clinton for the last 30 years: her convictions.
docs.abstract: Elizabeth-Merry Condon letter defends Sen Hillary Clinton against David Brooks's charge that she is driven by political expediency in Dubai ports deal and other issues (March 12 Op-Ed column)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: I wish to commend you for your enthusiastic endorsement of Hillary Rodham Clinton for the United States Senate from New York (editorial, Oct. 22). Mrs. Clinton has proved that where one comes from matters much less than one's intelligence, tenacity and dedication to one's goals. In that sense, she has shown herself to be yet another in the traditional line of newcomers who have come to New York and improved it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Jean Lyden, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John K. Lyden of Armonk, N.Y., was married yesterday to Jay Robert Murphy, a son of Elizabeth Davis Murphy of Deerfield, N.H., and Robert J. Murphy of North Conway, N.H. Msgr. Charles M. Kavanagh performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Fatima Church in Wilmington, Vt. The couple, both 27, graduated from Villanova University. Mrs. Murphy teaches the second grade at the Advent School in Boston. She received a master's degree in education from the Bank Street College of Education. Her father is the senior managing director at Lyden, Dolan, Nick & Company, a specialist firm on the New York Stock Exchange. Mr. Murphy is an equities trader in Boston for BT Alex. Brown, a brokerage company. His mother, a former New Hampshire State Representative, is the founder of S & H/Murphy, a government lobbying firm in Concord, N.H. His father is the president of the Central Bancservice Corporation, debit and credit card processors in Chocorua, N.H.
